post.body: As a Biologist I'm very interested in the physiology and structural anatomy of Zombies. One can easily say there are many many puzzling aspects to Zombie biology. For instance, if they eat brains then why are they so stupid?

So we are peer2peer encrypted but everything is stored in cleartext on our computers, right? Then what stops NSA from creating an account, subscribing/following EVERYTHING, turning up the storage capacity for all stored files to a Terabyte or so, and then relaxing and reading everything at leisure on their own computers?

comment.body: @TheTerminator: I know where Sarah Connor is if you're interested...
Dammit @Border0464fred you made me laugh and milk came out my nose.

Ok, but then why encrypt peer2peer? Save NSA the trouble and just go cleartext everywhere. Then the only advantage, that I can see, is that you can trust that a website to be genuine because the owner has to approve changes. So skip the encryption.
Yes I had that thought shortly after I posted. So it seems that zeronet is "clear" but one is reasonably certain that the site you visit is genuine and not hacked.
